entry.title: Completed a training but shows up overdue and incomplete
entry.content:

I was wondering if anyone could shed light on this situation. A user completed a training and had a certificate to prove it, however the said training shows up overdue. 

With admin permissions, upon checking in the Assigned Items, the training shows that it has not been completed.

Does anyone know why?

Thank you!

entry.title: Is there a T-Code / Process knowledge & Training database for SAP HANA ECC/ME/EWM?
entry.content:
Hi SAP Q&A,

I'm looking for information & and training material for our big company of 40000 users where every job role needs different training/information how to execute certain tasks within the SAP Programs.

More specifically i'm looking for 2 things which i can't seem to find in this fasion:

1. A knowledge base containing WI's/How to's on transaction codes within SAP HANA ECC and EWM per catagory. Preferably devided / filtereably by catagories such as Logistics, Quality, Finance, Production, Masterdata Manamgement, Service Flows etc. 

2. A training database in a similar fasion as the above knowledge base with mini work instructions per catagory and transaction code / sub program part - (how to fill in what / where and what are the effects to the linked data in the overarching processes? ) 

--------------------------

What i did find at the SAP sites but does not seems not to fulfill what i'm asking above: 

  1. SAP Support Page: SAP Services and Support
  2. SAP Learning Page: SAP Learning - SAP Community
  3. SAP Learning Blog and links: SAP Certification Transformation: How You Can Get ... - SAP Community
  4. Free open SAP Courses: Free online courses migrated from openSAP to the SAP Learning site -> Since 30-07-24 migrated with: Learning.sap.com and now mostly not ‘free’ anymore.
  5. New Digital Learning and Certification from SAP | SAP News Center -> SAP Learning Hub | Your Online E-Learning Enablement Platform -> SAP Partner Portal | welcome -> SAP Partner Program l Become an SAP Partner 
  6. Help SAP Portal: SAP Help Portal
  7. SAP Glossary: SAP Glossary | SAP Help Portal
  8. SAP HANA Help Portal: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition | SAP Help Portal
  9. SAP: Community: SAP Community
  10. SAP Resource Center: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  11. SAP Service / Support to create S-Accounts for users to access the above: Presentation Title (sap.com)  
  12. SAP For Me: Home - SAP for Me (need login)

entry.title: Controlling Reports: Aging Reports - Calculation errors in SAP B1 TB_1100 training manual
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I was preparing a training session on the Controlling Reports: Aging Reports using the training Manual when I come across to calculation errors of the Balance Due, Aging Intervals and the Percentages on the training Manual TB-1100 (page 225 or 235 on slide).

I request the update of this to ensure consistency and correctness of the training data.

Below the screen with the errors and attached is the correct information.

"...In the image you can see both A/R invoices for Funtech the customer and A/P invoices for Funtech the
vendor. The total balance due took into consideration the A/P invoices amount."

Best Regards

Santos Joao

entry.title: Urgent: Issues with SAP Certification Renewal and Learning Hub Subscription
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am reaching out to share my recent experience and seek guidance regarding the renewal of my SAP certification and the purchase of an individual Learning Hub subscription.

I have been an SAP consultant for 13 years, working both as a partner and now as a customer. Recently, I received a notification to extend the validity of my SAP certification. Upon realizing that I needed to purchase a Learning Hub subscription, I informed my manager, who encouraged me to keep my certification valid. Consequently, I purchased an individual Learning Hub subscription on Thursday (Order ID: 0002281064).

To my surprise, I did not receive any confirmation or access to the Learning Hub even after 24 hours. I raised multiple support tickets but struggled to get a proper response. On Sunday, I finally received a response from an SAP store admin, who mistakenly treated my request as a partner request. After clarifying that it was an individual request, they informed me that they couldn't fulfill the order and suggested purchasing certification attempts instead.

I am utterly surprised and annoyed by this response and the lack of maturity from SAP Learning support. Here are my concerns:

  1. What are the guidelines for maintaining SAP certification validity, especially when changing companies? Do certifications lapse with a change in organization?
  2. Where can I find relevant support and guidance for individual certification renewal and Learning Hub subscriptions?
  3. Why is there no proper channel or guidance to address these issues?

I believe it is crucial for people to be aware of these challenges. I am on the verge of losing my certification due to the lack of proper guidance from SAP. I hope this post brings attention to the issue and helps others who might be facing similar challenges.

Thank you for your support and guidance.

SAP Learning Solution  Certification  SAP Extended Warehouse Management @SAP

entry.title: Can't see your certifications? Complete your SAP Universal ID setup
entry.content:
Your SAP Universal ID might be missing a secondary email address. This additional email is required for account recovery purposes and to
manage your certifications effectively. Please add at least one additional email address by visiting the Universal ID account manager.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: SAP learning journey
entry.content:
Dear SAP professionals,

I'm a Data Analyst and aspiring Data Scientist working in a financial team within the banking industry. 

SAP universe is pretty new to me, and I'd like to understand the basics for my next job. What learning journey would you recommend? I was considering following this 12-course curriculum:

Intro

  • Learning the Basics of SAP Fiori
  • Introducing the Banking Industry
  • Provisioning Data to SAP HANA

S/4HANA

  • Overview of Financials in SAP S/4HANA
  • Discovering SAP S/4HANA embedded analytics
  • Outlining Cost Management and Profitability Analysis in SAP S/4HANA

BW/4HANA

  • Creating Queries in SAP BW/4HANA
  • Implementing a Data Warehouse Using SAP BW/4HANA
  • Developing Regression Models with the Python Machine Learning Client for SAP HANA

SAC & BO

  • Leveraging SAP Analytics Cloud Functionality for Enterprise Planning
  • Learning the Basics of SAP BI
  • Discovering SAP BusinessObjects Web Intelligence

From what I learned so far, BW/4HANA seems to be the data architecture behind S/4HANA (Fiori being the GUI), which is the business layer, then SAC is the global analytics solution for all SAP products (replacing the traditional BO).

Please let me know if that sounds coherent, according to your know-how (maybe I don't need to learn S/4HANA, or need to learn more about SAC...). Any feedback is welcome!

Thanks a lot for your guidance

entry.title: Learning Hub Partner Edition - Four attempts for certification
entry.content:
Hi colleagues!

Not so long ago we bought a SAP Learning Hub Subscription - Partner Edition so one of our consultants can take the assessment and comply with the Stay Certified program. 

We're seeing that after he activated the subscription 4 attempts were made available. Today we bought one more license for another consultant and was activated successfully. My question is:

Are the 4 attempts per user or global for all user licenses that we acquire?

For example:
2 Users = 4 attempts per user = 8 attempts in total.

2 Users or more = 4 attempts in total.

In my understanding the attempts should be per user and not limited to 4 globally. Am I correct about this?

Thanks in advance for your help!

Kind regards!

entry.title: SAP ABAP RAP - Missing value on UI after data created
entry.content:
Dear All,

I encounter an issue where my RAP Application does not return value on UI after created.

The scenario I follow is using /DMO/travel and /DMO/booking (One Travel can have multiple booking)

For example i choose travel number 4136, then i want to create another item booking. I fill the data here then i click save.

After click save, UI not return the data i have just filled, only the price value show up:

 

I am using unmanaged RAP, not sure what is wrong. I do check at Method cba_booking here, this should do the job to return the value to UI.

Appreciate your help and answer.

Thanks.
